DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Unit of Quantity OMOP CDM Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:An indication of the type of unit of measure being used to express a quantity.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An indication of the type of unit of measure being used to express a quantity._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.preferredName: OMOP Common Data Model Biospecimen Unit of Quantity Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An open community data standard, designed to standardize the structure and content of observational data and to enable efficient analyses that can produce reliable evidence._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions.
